definition: see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
paragraph/section/segment/stage (of a process)/classifier for stories, periods of time, lengths of thread etc

sentences.english: They governed the city with a heavy hand.
sentences.chinese: 他们用高压手段统治该城。

sentences.english: Public outrage over the government's heavy-handedness was instant.
sentences.chinese: 公众对政府的高压手段的愤怒是瞬间。

sentences.english: Starting in 1972, we were exposed to such a Soviet steamroller.
sentences.chinese: 从一九七二年起，我们就领教了苏联这种高压手段。

sentences.english: Bismarch ruled Germany by a strong hand.
sentences.chinese: 俾斯麦用高压手段统治德国。

sentences.english: Most people condemned his high-handed action.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人谴责他的高压手段。

definition: use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret

to use foreigners to subdue foreigners (idiom); let the barbarians fight it out among themselves (traditional policy of successive dynasties)/Use Western science and technology to counter imperialist encroachment. (late Qing modernizing slogan)
to use gain as a lure
